sources.title: Clear Skies
sources.description:
Young Sasha fell in love with the pilot Alexei at first sight, being a schoolgirl. Then they met during the Great War - they had only a few days of happiness, and then Sasha received the news of the death of her lover. But she did not believe it - she waited, raised her son, and Alexei returned. He had to go through a lot after the war. Alexei returned from captivity, so he was suspected of betrayal. Alexei, a former hero, started drinking, but Sasha did everything to support her loved one.

Year of production: 1961

Directed by: Grigory Chukhray
Written by: Daniil Khrabrovitsky
Director of photography: Sergey Poluyanov
Music: Mikhail Ziv
Production designer: Boris Nemechek
Starring: Nina Drobysheva, Yevgeny Urbansky

metadata.Plot: At the outset of the War, Alexei,an airman, marries Sasha Lvova, a young factory worker. One day, Alexei does not return from his mission and he is thought to be dead. Some time after the end of hostilities though, he reappears : taken prisoner, he has managed to survive. But everybody besides Sasha rejects him;to make matters worse, he is expelled from the party. Alexei sinks into despair and alcoholism. Fortunately, Stalin dies and his lot improves at last.
metadata.Actors: Nina Drobysheva, Evgeniy Urbanskiy, Natalya Kuzmina
